aphids.name: Aphids
aphids.description: Small, soft-bodied insects that feed on plant sap, causing damage to leaves and stems
symptoms: Sticky honeydew on leaves and stems
Visible clusters of small green, black, or white insects
Sooty mold growth on honeydew deposits

treatments.application: Mix 2 tablespoons per gallon of water, spray on affected areas
treatments.timing: Early morning or evening every 3-5 days
treatments.safety_notes: Safe for beneficial insects when dry, avoid spraying during bloom

treatments.application: Spray directly on aphids, ensure good coverage
treatments.safety_notes: Test on small area first, rinse edible crops before harvest

treatments.application: Follow label instructions for dilution and application
treatments.timing: Apply when pest pressure is high
treatments.safety_notes: Wear protective equipment, avoid during bloom, toxic to bees

prevention: Encourage beneficial insects like ladybugs and lacewings
Use reflective mulch to deter aphids
Monitor plants regularly for early detection
Plant companion plants like marigolds and catnip

spider_mites.name: Spider Mites
spider_mites.description: Tiny arachnids that feed on plant cells, causing stippling and webbing on leaves
symptoms: Fine stippling or speckling on leaves
Yellow or bronze discoloration of leaves
Fine webbing on leaves and stems
Tiny moving dots on leaf undersides

treatments.application: Release beneficial mites according to supplier instructions
treatments.safety_notes: Completely safe, avoid pesticides that harm beneficials

treatments.application: Spray thoroughly on all leaf surfaces
treatments.timing: Every 7-10 days, avoid hot sunny conditions
treatments.safety_notes: May cause leaf burn in high temperatures

treatments.application: Follow label rates, ensure good coverage
treatments.safety_notes: Rotate with different modes of action to prevent resistance

prevention: Regular water spraying to increase humidity
Quarantine new plants before introducing to garden

powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
powdery_mildew.description: Fungal disease that appears as white powdery spots on leaves and stems
symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on leaves
Spots spread to cover entire leaf surface

treatments.application: 1 teaspoon per quart water with drop of dish soap
treatments.timing: Spray weekly, avoid during hot sunny periods
treatments.safety_notes: Safe for edible crops, rinse before harvest

treatments.application: Mix 1 part milk with 10 parts water
treatments.timing: Spray every 3-4 days in early morning
treatments.safety_notes: Completely safe, may leave residue that washes off

treatments.application: Follow label instructions for concentration
treatments.timing: Apply at first sign of disease
treatments.safety_notes: Wear protective equipment, observe pre-harvest intervals

prevention: Ensure good air circulation around plants
Water at soil level rather than on leaves

late_blight.name: Late Blight
late_blight.description: Serious fungal-like disease that can quickly destroy tomato and potato crops
symptoms: Dark brown or black spots on leaves
White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
Rapid plant collapse in humid conditions

treatments.application: Apply according to label instructions
treatments.safety_notes: Can cause phytotoxicity, avoid copper buildup in soil

treatments.application: Destroy infected plant material, do not compost
treatments.timing: As soon as symptoms are noticed
treatments.safety_notes: Wear gloves, clean tools between plants

treatments.application: Follow label rates and timing
treatments.safety_notes: Rotate with different fungicide classes

prevention: Monitor weather conditions for disease-favorable periods

whiteflies.name: Whiteflies
whiteflies.description: Small white flying insects that feed on plant sap and transmit viral diseases
symptoms: Tiny white flying insects when plant is disturbed

treatments.application: Place traps near affected plants
treatments.safety_notes: Safe for environment, may catch beneficial insects

treatments.application: Spray on leaf undersides where eggs are laid
treatments.safety_notes: Safe for most plants, test on small area first

treatments.application: Soil drench or foliar spray per label
treatments.safety_notes: Toxic to bees, avoid during bloom

prevention: Use reflective mulch to confuse whiteflies
Remove weeds that serve as alternate hosts
Inspect new plants before bringing into garden
Use row covers on susceptible crops
Encourage beneficial insects like parasitic wasps

bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot
bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing spots on leaves, stems, and fruits of solanaceous crops
symptoms: Small dark spots with yellow halos on leaves
Fruit spots are raised and scabby

treatments.application: Apply preventively according to label
treatments.safety_notes: May cause phytotoxicity in cool, wet conditions

treatments.application: Prune lower branches, space plants properly
treatments.safety_notes: Sanitize pruning tools between plants

treatments.application: Follow label instructions carefully
treatments.safety_notes: Use sparingly to prevent resistance development

prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds and transplants

nutrient_deficiency_nitrogen.name: Nitrogen Deficiency
nutrient_deficiency_nitrogen.description: Lack of nitrogen causing yellowing of older leaves and stunted growth
symptoms: Yellowing of older, lower leaves first
Pale green coloration of entire plant

treatments.application: Apply 2-4 inches around plants, work into soil
treatments.safety_notes: Ensure manure is well-aged to avoid burning plants

treatments.application: Dilute according to package instructions
treatments.timing: Apply every 2-3 weeks during growing season
treatments.safety_notes: Strong odor, apply in evening to reduce smell

treatments.application: Follow soil test recommendations
treatments.safety_notes: Avoid over-application which can burn plants

prevention: Regular soil testing to monitor nutrient levels
Use cover crops to fix nitrogen
Avoid excessive watering that leaches nutrients
